event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Insure that the board is securely installed on the system.

Use the cryptoadm(1M) command

    cryptoadm list -p

to check whether "dca/x" (where x is a number) is listed under "kernel hardware providers". If so, run diagnostics on the hardware provider using SUNVTS following the procedures described in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 Board User's Guide.

If "dca/x" does not exist or SUNVTS diagnostic tests fail, follow the procedures described in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 Board User's Guide to replace the board or schedule a repair procedure to replace it.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris Fault Manager has determined that a hardware fault requiring repair action was detected on a Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 board.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item: The Message ID:   %MSGID% indicates diagnosis has determined that a Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 board is faulty. The SCA1000 (dca) driver has disabled the cryptographic accelerator interfaces.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The board will no longer function as a cryptographic accelerator until the problem has been resolved.
event_registry_properties.name: po-action
event_registry_properties.item:
Ensure that the board is securely installed on the system.

Use the cryptoadm(1M) command

    cryptoadm list -p

to check whether "dca/x" (where x is a number) is listed under "kernel hardware providers". If so, run diagnostics on the hardware provider using SUNVTS following the procedures described in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 Board User's Guide.

Use the fmdump(1M) command

    fmdump -vu event-id

to view the results of diagnosis and the specific Field Replaceable Unit (FRU) identified for replacement.

The event-id can be found in the EVENT-ID field of the message. For example:

    EVENT-ID: 39b30371-f009-c76c-90ee-b245784d2277
event_registry_properties.name: po-description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris Fault Manager has detected a hardware failure on the Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 card.
event_registry_properties.name: po-impact
event_registry_properties.item: The card will no longer function as a cryptographic accelerator.
event_registry_properties.name: po-response
event_registry_properties.item: The module has been disabled and un-registered as a hardware provider to the Solaris Cryptographic Framework.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The accelerator board's driver has been disabled and un-registered as a hardware provider to the Solaris Cryptographic Framework.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Sun Crypto Accelerator 1000 Hardware May Be Faulty
